formula: a(n) = n XOR 2. - _Joerg Arndt_, Feb 07 2013G.f.: [2-x-2x^2+3x^3]/[(1-x)^2(1+x^2)]. - _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 24 2004The sequences 'Nimsum n + m' seem to have the general o.g.f. p(x)/q(x) with p, q polynomials and q(x) = (1-x)^2*prod[k=0..inf, 1+x^(2^e(k))], with sum[k=0..inf, 2^e(k)] = m. - _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 24 2004a(n) = n + 2(-1)^[n/2]. - Mitchell Harris, Jan 10 2005a(n) = OR(n,2) - AND(n,2). - _Gary Detlefs_, Feb 06 2013
maple: nimsum := proc(a,b) local t1,t2,t3,t4,l; t1 := convert(a+2^200,base,2); t2 := convert(b+2^200,base,2); t3 := evalm(t1+t2); map(x->x mod 2, t3); t4 := convert(evalm(%),list); l := convert(t4,base,2,10); sum(l[k]*10^(k-1), k=1..nops(l)); end;
